2269.title: Problems in bioinformatics
2269.summary: This bioinformatics project focuses on developing computational models to predict the impact of gene regulation changes on development and disease. It involves creating custom algorithms, statistical simulations, and machine learning solutions for biological data analysis. Potential projects include using genetic programming (GP) to predict microRNA target sites, support vector machines (SVM) to identify microRNA genes, or combining GP and SVMs to identify related proteins. The expected outcome is improved understanding and prediction of gene regulation's role in biological processes.

2504.title: Merging of spatial data
2504.summary: This project explores efficient merging techniques for spatial data indexed by space-filling curves, addressing the challenges of high-velocity geodata ingestion. Drawing inspiration from LSM-trees, the research will investigate and adapt merging strategies to optimize insertion rates in spatial data structures like R-trees. The expected outcome is a novel approach for merging spatial data that enhances performance in big data scenarios.

2518.title: Uninterrupted Instruction Supply in Servers
2518.summary: This project addresses front-end stalls in servers caused by large instruction footprints and branch mispredictions. Building upon the Boomerang prefetcher, which prefetches instruction cache blocks and BTB entries, the research will focus on enabling continuous prefetching even after branch mispredictions. The goal is to improve miss coverage and overall performance by overcoming the limitations of Boomerang's current design. The expected outcome is a technique that reduces front-end stalls and enhances instruction supply in servers.

2557.title: The Strategic Value of Big Data Analytics
2557.summary: This project investigates the strategic value of big data analytics in Norwegian companies. Through a quantitative study, the research will examine how these companies apply big data analytics to generate business value. The project involves collaboration with the Big Data Observatory, providing experience in research methods and quantitative data analysis. The expected outcome is a data-driven understanding of the relationship between big data analytics and business value creation in the Norwegian context.

2560.title: What is the Business Value of Artificial Intelligence?
2560.summary: This master's project explores the business value of AI by examining the readiness of private and public organizations to adopt AI technologies and the value derived from these investments. The research will involve data collection and analysis in collaboration with the Big Data Observatory. The expected outcome is a better understanding of how organizations plan to use AI and the necessary steps for successful AI adoption.

2561.title: Artificial Intelligence in Business: Uncovering challenges and obstacles of adoption.
2561.summary: This project investigates the challenges and obstacles hindering the adoption of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in businesses. It will explore technological, organizational, and human factors that impede successful AI implementation. The research will involve data collection and analysis in collaboration with the Big Data Observatory, aiming to uncover practical insights into overcoming these challenges and facilitating effective AI integration in business environments.

2564.title: The potential of Artificial Intelligence for public administration
2564.summary: This project investigates the adoption of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in public administration, in collaboration with SINTEF Digital. It involves data collection and analysis to determine the current status, potential applications, and realized value of AI implementations within public organizations. The research will explore AI's use in areas like fraud detection, chatbots, and infrastructure monitoring, aiming to understand its impact and potential benefits in the public sector. The expected outcome is a report detailing the findings on AI adoption and its value in public administration.

2565.title: Human-Machine Symbiosis: How does decision-making change in the age of Big Data Analytics?
2565.summary: This project investigates how big data analytics impacts human decision-making, focusing on cognitive overload and biases that hinder insight adoption. In collaboration with the Big Data Observatory, the research will involve designing a study protocol and collecting neurophysiological data (eye-tracking and EEG) from participants. The goal is to understand how individuals process and integrate data-driven insights, ultimately informing strategies to improve human-machine symbiosis in decision-making contexts.

2566.title: What are the skills of the future: A look at how Artificial Intelligence and Analytics change the competences of computer science graduates
2566.summary: This project investigates the evolving skills required of computer science graduates due to the rise of AI and big data analytics. In collaboration with the Big Data Observatory, the research will employ focus groups and surveys to gather data from industry representatives. The expected outcome is a detailed analysis of essential skills and recommendations for educational institutions to adapt their curricula to meet industry demands.

2700.title: Computer Vision in Bad Weather conditions / Bad Visibility
2700.summary: This project explores computer vision techniques for autonomous driving in adverse weather conditions like rain and snow, focusing on robust object detection (vehicles, road markings, obstacles). It will investigate combining machine learning and classical computer vision to develop algorithms that account for image degradation caused by weather. The project will utilize an existing "bad weather driving" database and offers potential collaboration with an industry partner, aiming to improve environment perception and distance estimation in challenging visibility.

2726.title: TrønderEnergi: Explainable time-series forecasting
2726.summary: This project explores explainable time-series forecasting for TrønderEnergi, focusing on making machine learning-based energy forecasts understandable for domain experts without ML expertise. The research will involve literature review, prototype development, and evaluation using real-world datasets like consumption, grid loss, weather, and power production data. The key challenge is to provide explanations that enable domain experts to understand and trust the forecasts, facilitating better decision-making in the operating center.

2737.title: Large-scale agile software develpment
2737.summary: This project investigates the adaptation and combination of agile and traditional practices in large-scale software development. It will analyze second-generation large-scale agile methods like SAFe, LeSS, Spotify model, and DAD. The project will begin with a literature review, potentially extending to an empirical study. The research can leverage material from the Agile 2.0 competence-building project with industry partners. Expected outcomes include insights into effective large-scale agile practices and their application in industrial settings.

2747.title: Further development of a novel immune-inspired hybrid classification algorithm
2747.summary: This project aims to further develop the MAIM hybrid classification algorithm, which combines features of the Immune System with an Island Model Genetic Algorithm (IGA). Building upon promising preliminary results from previous work, the project will explore avenues to extend and refine the algorithm. The expected outcome is an improved classification algorithm with enhanced anomaly recognition capabilities.

2748.title: Bio-inspired techniques applied to remote sensing with hyperspectral data
2748.summary: This project explores bio-inspired techniques for hyperspectral remote sensing data analysis. Focusing on challenges posed by high dimensionality and redundancy, the research aims to improve classification and monitoring of environmental changes. The project builds upon previous work using evolutionary algorithms for spectral band selection. Current work involves applying Particle Swarm Optimization and superpixel analysis. The project welcomes students to explore alternative bio-inspired methods or focus on other aspects of hyperspectral image processing. Expected outcomes include improved data processing techniques and enhanced environmental monitoring capabilities.

2753.title: Particle Swarm Optimisation as a modelling tool for Climate Change
2753.summary: This project explores Particle Swarm Optimisation (PSO) as a modeling tool for climate change, focusing on individual behavior and contributions to benefit future populations. The research aims to develop a PSO modeling environment to study how individuals can be incentivized to increase their contribution/sacrifice in addressing climate change. The expected outcome is a functional PSO model capable of simulating and analyzing societal behaviors related to climate action.

2824.title: [2023/2024 Collaboration with Refinitiv AS] - Deep Learning Models for detecting wind turbines’ curtailment
2824.summary: This project explores deep learning models for detecting wind turbine curtailment to improve wind power output forecasts. It aims to develop algorithms that use weather conditions, system operator forecast plans, and price forecasts as inputs to predict curtailment events. The expected outcome is a more precise wind power forecast, enabling better decision-making for system operators and traders.

2867.title: Artificial Intelligence in the Healthcare sector
2867.summary: This project investigates the impact of Artificial Intelligence (AI) on healthcare professionals' work. It aims to understand how AI technologies, such as machine learning in radiology, are altering the roles of doctors, nurses, and administrative staff. The research will explore both the positive and negative consequences experienced by healthcare practitioners due to the increasing integration of AI in their daily tasks. The expected outcome is a comprehensive understanding of the evolving nature of work in healthcare due to AI.

2890.title: Application of AI in Norwegian Organization
2890.summary: This project analyzes quantitative and qualitative data from surveys of Norwegian organizations to understand the mechanisms affecting resource utilization when implementing AI solutions, particularly in the public sector. It combines survey data with a literature review to gain insights into AI adoption. The expected outcome is a report, written in English, suitable for scientific publication, detailing the factors influencing resource utilization during AI implementation.

2907.title: Organizational decision-making in the age of AI
2907.summary: This project investigates the impact of AI on organizational decision-making. It will empirically examine the effects and processes involved in transitioning to AI-driven decision structures within organizations. The research will focus on understanding how AI augmentation and automation influence decision-making processes, potentially impacting areas like forecasting, credit checks, and task automation. The expected outcome is a deeper understanding of the organizational changes resulting from AI adoption in decision-making.

2908.title: Responsible AI in organizations
2908.summary: This project explores the organizational implications of responsible AI adoption. It investigates the processes and structures organizations implement to achieve responsible AI indicators. The research aims to identify organizational gains, impacts on customer/citizen perception, and potential restrictions on technology use resulting from responsible AI adoption. The expected outcome is a comprehensive understanding of responsible AI's influence on organizational dynamics and stakeholder perceptions.

2909.title: Exploring the black box of AI Governance
2909.summary: This project explores the development and deployment of AI governance practices within organizations. It investigates the factors considered when establishing these practices, their implementation methods, and their impact on business and project performance. The research aims to understand how AI governance influences business value, ethical compliance, and regulatory adherence in AI projects.

2941.title: Improving Branch Prediction Accuracy for Cloud Applications
2941.summary: This project aims to improve branch prediction accuracy in cloud applications by optimizing the Branch Target Buffer (BTB) and the branch predictor. The BTB will be enhanced by investigating replacement policies to reduce miss rates. The branch predictor will be optimized by categorizing branches based on their performance impact and prioritizing the prediction of those that cause the most significant performance loss. The expected outcome is a more accurate and efficient branch prediction mechanism, leading to improved performance for cloud applications.

3064.title: Visual Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (VSLAM) for an Underwater Snake Robot (H2025-V2026)
3064.summary: This project focuses on developing Visual SLAM (VSLAM) for an underwater snake robot, addressing challenges like limited visibility and poor illumination. The research will involve experimenting with novel approaches in geometric models, statistical estimation, or machine learning to improve keypoint tracking, pose graph optimization, and integration of IMU measurements. Expected outcomes include a VSLAM system tailored for underwater environments, leveraging real video footage and a simulation environment for validation. Potential applications of machine learning for depth estimation and visual clutter detection will also be explored.

3084.title: Numerical Contours
3084.summary: This project focuses on developing a scalable annotation system for temporal and numerical expressions within large document collections, such as Wikipedia. The research will address annotating numerical quantities associated with entities, modeling units for easy conversions, and ensuring scalability. The project will leverage techniques from databases, information retrieval, and natural language processing to achieve these goals. The expected outcome is a functional annotator capable of processing large volumes of text and accurately extracting and representing numerical data.

3085.title: Semantic Text Indexing
3085.summary: This project explores semantic text indexing for improved information retrieval at scale. It investigates alternatives to black-box deep learning methods like word2vec for endowing text with semantics. The goal is to perform semantic text matching across millions of documents, addressing the limitations of keyword-based searches with underspecified queries. The research combines databases, information retrieval, and natural language processing techniques.

3086.title: Event Mining and Linking
3086.summary: This project focuses on mining and linking events from large news archives to create coherent storylines for users. It will employ data mining, information retrieval, and natural language processing techniques to extract events and contextualize them with related prior information. The expected outcome is an improved understanding and consumption of news through the weaving of events into comprehensive narratives.

3087.title: Learning Indexing Patterns from Annotated Document Collections
3087.summary: This project explores indexing annotated document collections to improve information retrieval based on entities, temporal expressions, and numerical ranges. Leveraging NLP tools like Stanford CoreNLP, the research aims to identify semantic patterns in annotations relevant to query logs. The goal is to develop indexing strategies that facilitate efficient selection of documents based on specific time periods, entity categories, and numerical ranges, drawing from databases, information retrieval, data mining, and NLP techniques.

3089.title: Text Driven Analytics and Visualization
3089.summary: This project focuses on developing a system for text-driven analytics and visualization, leveraging information extraction techniques on large text corpora. The system will utilize annotations like entities, time, and numbers to generate visualizations and enable users to perform analytics. The research areas include databases, information retrieval, and data mining. The expected outcome is a scalable system capable of extracting information and creating insightful visualizations from text data.

3124.title: An immune system approach to fake News Classification
3124.summary: This project explores an immune system-inspired approach to fake news classification, leveraging antibody-antigen concepts. The aim is to extend and refine existing methodologies in this area. Specific research directions and technologies will be determined by the student. Expected outcomes include improved fake news detection and a deeper understanding of applying immunological principles to information classification.

3136.title: *NEW*: Attention Beyond the Visible: Transformer Models for Pattern Inference Under Occlusion (2025-2026)
3136.summary: This project explores Transformer models for inferring occluded patterns in visual or symbolic data, focusing on the mathematical foundations of attention mechanisms in managing uncertainty. It will analyze how self-attention layers decode superpositions, using tools like mutual information and rate-distortion theory. Potential directions include designing synthetic occlusion tasks, analyzing attention maps, and theoretically bounding reconstruction possibilities. The expected outcome is a deeper understanding of Transformer interpretability and representation learning under uncertainty.

3158.title: Managing big data volumes
3158.summary: This project explores methods for parallel insertion of large data volumes, potentially focusing on specific applications like geographic satellite data. It investigates efficient parallel insertion into traditional tree structures such as B-trees and R-trees, as well as handling sequential data like logs. The research aims to address the scalability limitations of parallel databases with shared logs, with potential applications in storing GPS trajectories. The expected outcome is a better understanding of parallel data insertion techniques and their applicability to big data management.

3159.title: Merging of offline databases
3159.summary: This project explores solutions for merging offline databases, focusing on scenarios like rescue teams needing to synchronize data in disconnected environments. It will investigate and compare techniques such as Conflict-free Replicated Data Types (CRDTs), mergeable data structures, and operational transformations. The expected outcome is an evaluation of these methods and potentially a proposed solution for efficient and reliable offline database merging.

3161.title: NoSQL/NewSQL (scalable)  databases
3161.summary: This project explores NoSQL and NewSQL databases, focusing on scalability. Potential research areas include transaction models in NewSQL, multi-dimensional indexing, autotuning, automatic upgrades, autoscaling, and indexing/storage in NoSQL databases. The project aims to improve the performance and management of these databases. Specific outcomes will depend on the chosen research area and the student's interests, potentially involving a specific database.

3162.title: Similarity of trajectories
3162.summary: This project explores algorithms for trajectory similarity, applicable to ride-sharing, route identification, and Strava segments. The core task involves developing an efficient index to pre-process trajectory data before applying computationally intensive similarity algorithms like Dynamic Time Warping. The research will build upon previous work using Locality Sensitive Hashing (LSH), focusing on optimizing parameters to achieve optimal performance across diverse trajectory datasets. The expected outcome is a practical and efficient indexing method that enhances the speed and accuracy of trajectory similarity analysis.

3163.title: AI for sustainable business models
3163.summary: This project explores the relationship between Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Sustainable Business Models (SBMs). It investigates how companies can leverage AI for SBM implementation and conceptualizes the connection between AI, SBM, and competitive performance. The research aims to address the current gap in understanding the mechanisms by which AI enables SBMs, ultimately helping firms accelerate their transition towards sustainability.

3165.title: AI for understanding marine ecosystems by using underwater acoustic data
3165.summary: This project focuses on developing AI models for understanding marine ecosystems using underwater acoustic data. It addresses the challenges of identifying and classifying underwater sounds, which are affected by variability, sparsity, and noise. The project will involve working with large acoustic datasets and ocean observatory data, utilizing transformer models to classify and analyze sound events. Collaboration with NTNU's Department of Biology will provide domain expertise. The expected outcome is effective classification and analysis models for marine soundscapes.

3182.title: Eye-tracking and training novice programmers  (multiple projects)
3182.summary: This project explores using eye-tracking and dialogue to improve novice programmer debugging skills. The research involves developing a gaze-enabled feedback tool, conducting usability testing, and performing a larger user study to evaluate the system's effectiveness. The expected outcome is a system that leverages expert gaze and dialogue to guide novices in identifying and correcting bugs. The project requires strong programming skills in Python/Java and a background in system design.

3183.title: AI-Based gaze-aware feedback system for programming  (multiple projects)
3183.summary: This project focuses on developing and evaluating an AI-based gaze-aware feedback system to assist students in real-time during programming. It integrates eye-tracking data and IDE logs to provide targeted help. The project involves designing and implementing the tool, conducting usability testing, and performing a larger user study to evaluate its effectiveness. The expected outcome is an efficient and effective system for assisting students with programming, validated through user studies and data analysis. Python is the primary programming language.

3187.title: Artificial Intelligence and pair programming (multiple projects)
3187.summary: This project explores using AI to predict pair programming performance by analyzing data from eye-tracking, EEG, heart rate, and facial expressions. Students will collect data during pair programming sessions, develop prediction algorithms based on interaction features, and compare algorithm performance. The expected outcome is a model that identifies key factors contributing to successful pair programming. The project requires a background in machine learning/deep learning and Python programming skills.

3188.title: Artificial Intelligence and Biometrics in Education (multiple projects)
3188.summary: This project explores AI-driven educational tools using biometric data (eye-tracking, EEG, heart rate, etc.) to enhance student learning. The research involves collecting and analyzing multi-modal biometric data to predict student behavior and performance. The expected outcome is the development of AI solutions that personalize and improve learning experiences. Requires background in system design, machine learning, and programming skills in Python/Java.

3245.title: Learning software organisations
3245.summary: This project investigates organizational learning and knowledge management within software companies, focusing on how these processes occur at different organizational levels, particularly at the team level. It begins with a literature review on organizational learning and knowledge management in software engineering. The project may extend into an empirical study within a Norwegian software engineering environment, potentially using a case study suggested by the student or found through the supervisor's network. The expected outcome is a better understanding of how software organizations facilitate learning and knowledge sharing.

3258.title: AI-based Environment Perception for Underwater Robots
3258.summary: This project explores AI-based environment perception for autonomous underwater snake robots, focusing on computer vision techniques to address challenges like limited visibility and visual clutter. It aims to create a dynamic, situation-dependent model of the robot's surroundings and estimate its ego-motion. The project will evaluate classical and modern machine learning/deep learning methods to determine their suitability for underwater environments with limited visibility. The expected outcome is an empirical assessment of different computer vision approaches for underwater robot navigation.

3261.title: Uncertainty Quantification in Detection and Classification Problems
3261.summary: This project investigates uncertainty quantification in deep learning classifiers for detection and classification, focusing on scenarios where incorrect predictions have high consequences. The student will review and implement methods for uncertainty-aware classifiers, testing their performance on out-of-distribution and manipulated images using datasets including a DNV boat image dataset, RETINA, CIFAR-10, and CIFAR-100. The research aims to identify the types of manipulations that confuse classifiers and to distinguish between epistemic and aleatoric uncertainty, ultimately improving the reliability of AI in high-risk applications.

3266.title: Biometrics and Neuro-conceptualization
3266.summary: This project investigates the neural processing of visual conceptual models (UML, BPMN) using biometric data (heart rate, EEG, eye-tracking). It aims to understand how the brain comprehends these models, exploring individual differences and optimal modeling approaches. The research involves a literature review of neuroscience, neurolinguistics, and IT, followed by experiments to analyze model comprehension. Expected outcomes include insights into brain processing during model comprehension and identification of modeling practices that enhance understanding, potentially leading to a scientific publication.

3285.title: Sustainability by design
3285.summary: This project explores integrating sustainability into software development by addressing how to express, elicit, and balance sustainability requirements within agile methods. It includes a literature review and evaluation of techniques for handling sustainability requirements. The expected outcome is a better understanding of how to achieve sustainability by design in IT solutions, with consideration of both short-term and long-term adherence to sustainability goals. The project is affiliated with NTNU Center for Sustainable ICT (CESICT) and the goforIT network.

3293.title: Predictive Maintenance in Fish Farming
3293.summary: This project aims to develop predictive maintenance methods for fish farming operations, focusing on automating the prediction of maintenance needs to optimize cleaning cycles and reduce downtime. The research will identify and rank maintenance operations based on economic impact and then develop predictive models to detect maintenance needs before problems occur. The project will leverage data and technology in collaboration with Piscada, utilizing their industrial cloud-based software platform. The expected outcome is a reliable system for predicting maintenance needs, improving efficiency and sustainability in fish farming.

3294.title: Tag inference
3294.summary: This project aims to develop a model for automated equipment tag inference using time series data from Building Automation Systems. The student will preprocess time series data, select a suitable classification model, and evaluate class optimization through clustering. Utilizing years of high-frequency data from numerous buildings, the model will classify equipment based on its data emissions over a two-week period. The expected outcome is a functional model that can accurately infer equipment tags, contributing to Piscada's industrial cloud-based software platform for PropTech and Industrial IoT.

3295.title: Predictive Maintenance in Building Automation & HVAC Systems
3295.summary: This project explores predictive maintenance in building automation, specifically HVAC systems, to optimize maintenance schedules and reduce unnecessary replacements. The research will identify and rank maintenance operations suitable for automated prediction based on economic impact. The core objective is to develop predictive methods for these operations, enabling early detection of maintenance needs. This project will be in collaboration with Piscada, and will leverage their industrial cloud platform. Expected outcomes include improved maintenance efficiency, reduced costs, and increased sustainability.

3305.title: [NorwAI] Neural Machine Translation in Written Norwegian - Bokmål and Nynorsk - with Generative Pre-trained Transformer
3305.summary: This project explores Neural Machine Translation (NMT) between Bokmål and Nynorsk using a Generative Pre-trained Transformer (GPT) model. It addresses the challenge of limited parallel data by investigating methods to leverage pre-trained language models for translation. The project involves a literature review, designing an efficient GPT-based NMT approach, and evaluating its applicability. The research utilizes the Norwegian Colossal Corpus and a NorwAI-provided GPT model. Expected outcomes include an efficient NMT model and solutions to challenges like named entity recognition, long text translation, and reducing training overhead.

3319.title: Enterprise Architectures for learning and knowledge transfer in sustainable cities
3319.summary: This project explores using Enterprise Architecture (EA) to facilitate knowledge transfer and learning between sustainable cities. It aims to enhance EA models to capture and replicate successful ICT ecosystems across different urban environments. The project involves a literature review, developing a prototype EA model, and validating its effectiveness in supporting knowledge transfer. The expected outcome is an improved EA model that promotes the adoption of sustainable solutions in cities by enabling effective learning from other cities.

3320.title: Cities as Urban Living Labs
3320.summary: This project investigates Urban Living Labs (ULLs) as a method for citizen engagement in urban service design. It aims to establish a small-scale ULL, potentially focusing on citizen health and well-being (e.g., SWELL project). The project involves a literature review, selection of co-creation and data evaluation methodologies, identification of a specific ULL focus, ULL establishment, and validation. Expected outcomes include a functional ULL and insights into its effectiveness in engaging citizens and improving urban services.

3321.title: ICT for Health & Well-being in Built Environments
3321.summary: This project investigates the role of Information and Communication Technology (ICT) in promoting health and well-being within sustainable built environments, as part of the SWELL project. It involves literature reviews on ICT's impact on health in buildings and relevant digital technologies. The core task is to design and prototype an interactive solution to engage building users, followed by a thorough evaluation of the prototype's effectiveness. The expected outcome is a tested ICT solution that contributes to healthier and more sustainable built environments.

3328.title: [ExerGames] Play to get fit 2024/2025
3328.summary: This project aims to develop novel exergame concepts and technologies, balancing fun gameplay with effective physical exercise. The project involves a theoretical study of exergames and motivational game mechanics, followed by the implementation of a prototype using various technologies. The final phase focuses on evaluating and testing the prototype. The expected outcome is a functional exergame prototype and insights into designing engaging and effective exergames.

3331.title: Social Robotics: HCI in Norwegian
3331.summary: This project explores Human-Robot Interaction (HRI) by developing social robot functionalities with Norwegian language capabilities. Utilizing robots equipped with audio-visual sensors and a modular backend, the research focuses on natural language processing to enable communication in both Norwegian and English. The expected outcome is the creation, implementation, and evaluation of new HRI functions, potentially showcased at public events. The project requires strong programming skills and an interest in HCI.

3332.title: Analysing the Effectiveness of Last Level (Data) Cache for Cloud Applications
3332.summary: This project investigates the effectiveness of Last Level Caches (LLC) for cloud applications, which often have large data working sets. The research will use hardware simulation to analyze the performance of cloud workloads under different cache configurations and eviction policies. The goal is to identify bottlenecks and explore potential solutions to reduce energy consumption, area usage, and wasted cycles in future processor designs. The expected outcome is a better understanding of LLC performance in cloud environments and recommendations for optimization.

3383.title: Analyzing the Effectiveness of Last Level Cache for Cloud Applications
3383.summary: This project investigates the effectiveness of Last Level Caches (LLC) for cloud applications, which often have large data working sets that may not be efficiently handled by LLCs. Through simulations of cloud workloads with varying cache configurations and eviction policies, the research aims to identify performance bottlenecks. The expected outcome is a data-driven analysis that informs potential optimizations for future processor designs, focusing on reducing wasted energy, area, and cycles associated with LLCs in cloud environments.

3386.title: An Immune System Approach to Music recommendation
3386.summary: This project explores applying immune system algorithms, specifically AIRS or similar approaches, to music recommendation systems. Building upon existing work using AIRS for content-based Automatic Playlist Continuation (APC), the project aims to enhance recommendation accuracy. The research may extend the methodology to incorporate both content-based and collaborative filtering techniques, potentially improving user-tailored music recommendations.

3387.title: Evolving personalised training programs to reduce/relieve Metabolic Syndrome
3387.summary: This project aims to develop personalized training programs using a Genetic Algorithm to mitigate Metabolic Syndrome. The algorithm will generate dynamic exercise routines that evolve with the patient's health status, promoting long-term well-being. The expected outcome is a system that helps individuals adhere to effective exercise regimens, reducing the risk of cardiovascular diseases and type 2 diabetes associated with Metabolic Syndrome.

3398.title: Hybrid co-design toolkits
3398.summary: This project explores adapting traditional co-design methods and toolkits for hybrid environments, addressing the shift towards digital interaction in design workshops. The research involves a literature review, the creation of a framework for comparing co-design strategies, and the development of hybrid toolkit prototypes as case studies. The expected outcome is a better understanding of hybrid co-design and practical toolkits to facilitate inclusive participation in IT product development.

3399.title: Code re-use and binary diffing as tools for reverse engineering of firmware from unknown instruction set architectures
3399.summary: This project explores using code re-use and binary diffing to reverse engineer firmware from unknown ISAs, focusing on a Shimano STePS e-bike case study. It aims to infer ISA characteristics (instruction format, opcodes, register info, bit width, memory layout) by analyzing sequentially versioned firmware releases and correlating them with available metadata like changelogs. The research investigates how subroutines, data structures, and code changes can be inferred to aid in reverse engineering proprietary hardware platforms.

3408.title: Computational nanosystems: Toward real word tasks
3408.summary: This project explores artificial spin ice (ASI) within the reservoir computing framework for real-world tasks like MNIST and spoken digit recognition. Using the Flatspin simulator, the research will focus on optimizing input encoding, designing ASI reservoirs with sufficient computational power, and developing effective readout strategies. The project aims to demonstrate the potential of ASI as a computational substrate, building upon existing research within the SOCRATES and SpinENGIN projects. The research is closely connected to experimental work and simulations.

3411.title: Effects of Interpreted Languages on Microarchitectural Performance
3411.summary: This project investigates the microarchitectural performance impact of interpreted languages like Python and JavaScript, prevalent in cloud computing FaaS environments. It addresses the challenge of hardware treating program logic as data, leading to inefficient cache utilization and branch prediction. The project aims to develop a tool to track data and code within the cache, analyze front-end and back-end performance bottlenecks, and propose methods for efficient and energy-aware execution of interpreted workloads, ultimately optimizing cloud infrastructure performance.

3412.title: Application of artificial intelligence-based image soft-sensor to high temperature property study
3412.summary: This project focuses on developing an AI-based image soft-sensor to automate and improve the analysis of high-temperature material properties using images/videos from sessile drop experiments. The research involves data pre-processing, image labeling with expert input, and implementing a deep learning model for image analysis. Expected outcomes include a functional soft-sensor integrated with lab equipment, enabling efficient and accurate evaluation of material behavior at high temperatures, specifically wetting, softening, and melting kinetics.

3415.title: [NorwAI] Sentiment Analysis Based on Brain Signal Feedback
3415.summary: This project aims to develop a sentiment analysis method using fMRI brain signals to estimate the sentiment load of words. It involves literature review, collecting fMRI data paired with sentiment-annotated text, designing a system to map brain signals to sentiment, and evaluating the system's accuracy in estimating sentiment. The expected outcome is a reliable system for continuous sentiment estimation based on fMRI data, applicable in healthcare, social media, and marketing.

3421.title: Define your own project in Visual Computing
3421.summary: This master's project allows students to define their own research topic within Visual Computing, contingent on their performance in related courses (TDT4195, TDT4230) and the suitability of their project proposal. The specific research area, technologies, and expected outcomes are dependent on the student-defined project.

3427.title: Data science - in practice
3427.summary: This project investigates the gap between data-driven data science techniques and their practical application in organizations. Focusing on empirical case studies within sectors like energy and healthcare, the research aims to understand the conditions necessary for effective data science implementation in consequential decision-making. A key area of focus is enhancing the accountability and explainability of algorithms (XAI). This project is part of the SFI NorwAI initiative.

3432.title: Open data - from vision to reality?
3432.summary: This project investigates the gap between the vision of open data and its practical implementation, focusing on the Open Data Subsurface Universe (OSDU) platform. It will analyze the social, practical, and institutional conditions necessary for successful open data adoption within the energy sector (fossil, renewable, and CCS). The research will involve collaboration with industry partners like Equinor and AkerBP to assess the challenges and opportunities of using OSDU for data sharing, communication, and analytics related to geo-located assets. The expected outcome is a better understanding of how to bridge the gap between open data availability and its effective use in collaborative environments.

3433.title: Learned index and updates
3433.summary: This project investigates update handling in learned indexes, aiming to improve performance under high insert/update loads. It will survey existing techniques and propose enhancements. Additionally, the project explores learned multi-dimensional indexes, potentially focusing on the challenges of indexing string data. The expected outcome is a better understanding of update strategies for learned indexes and potential advancements in learned multi-dimensional indexing.

3501.title: Design Thinking learning with Emerging Technologies
3501.summary: This project explores enhancing design thinking education for students (under 18) by extending online learning tools with a learning analytics dashboard. It aims to capture and analyze learners' cognitive, affective, and physiological states using emerging technologies. The project involves a literature review, system implementation using Javascript, iterative testing, a user study to collect empirical data, and data analysis. Expected outcomes include a functional dashboard, insights into student learning processes, and recommendations for improving design thinking education.

3522.title: Constructing an AI-based, intelligent ground vehicle, level II
3522.summary: This project focuses on developing an AI-based intelligent ground vehicle using the Agilex LIMO robot platform. The research will explore cooperative robot interaction in dense environments, emphasizing intelligent behavior and autonomy over speed. The project involves specifying a vehicle goal (e.g., collision-free navigation, package delivery), implementing an intelligent component (e.g., vision, speech interaction), and addressing engineering challenges in communication, perception, behavior, or control. Expected outcomes include a functional mobile robot capable of interacting with other robots and/or humans, demonstrating intelligent capabilities.

3528.title: *NEW* Investigations on Situation Awareness Systems for an Autonomous Ferry
3528.summary: This project explores AI-driven situation awareness for autonomous ferries, focusing on processing sensor data to create a dynamic environmental representation. The research involves safe navigation, collision avoidance, and complex maneuver execution like docking. The project allows for specialization in machine learning or statistical model-based methods, depending on the student's interests and background. Expected outcomes include enhanced ferry autonomy through improved environmental understanding and decision-making capabilities.

3529.title: Learning analytics and AI in Education in Norway
3529.summary: This project investigates the adoption and application of Learning Analytics (LA) and AI in Education (AIED) within Norway. It aims to identify existing LA/AIED systems, analyze their practical implementation, and explore associated challenges and opportunities. The research will involve analyzing existing data from sources like the national expert group in learning analytics, Sikt, and NOKUT, with the option of collecting primary data through questionnaires or interviews. The expected outcome is a comprehensive understanding of LA/AIED usage in Norway and insights into its impact on educational practices.

3530.title: Reinforcement learning for multi-agent simulated autonomous driving
3530.summary: This project explores multi-agent reinforcement learning for autonomous driving in simulated urban environments. The research focuses on developing a self-learning scheme to control multiple simulated vehicles. The project can utilize the CARLA simulator or Agilex.ai LIMO robots. Expected outcomes include a functional multi-agent RL system and insights into its performance in autonomous driving scenarios.

3532.title: Empowering Children’s STEM Learning through Embodied Interaction and GenAI capabilities
3532.summary: This project explores using Motion-Based Technology (MBT) and GenAI to enhance children's STEM learning, particularly in math. It involves literature review, defining adaptive learning models using Multimodal LLMs, and developing technological interfaces. The project aims to identify MBT aspects supporting children's learning, create practical functionalities, and evaluate/refine these through experimentation. Requires data science, LLM integration, and strong programming skills (Python, C#, or JavaScript). Expected outcomes include a set of practices and technological interfaces that promote meaningful STEM learning through embodied interaction.

3535.title: Using LLMs and conversational agents to support children’s learning
3535.summary: This project explores using interactive mobile technology, enhanced with Large Language Models (LLMs) and conversational agents, to support children's science learning. The research involves literature review, app development integrating (M)LLMs, and user studies in schools or science museums. The project aims to determine how AI and gamification can enhance children's interest in science. Expected outcomes include a functional mobile application and empirical data on its effectiveness. Required skills include UX/UI design, (M)LLM integration, and front-end programming (JavaScript, CSS).

3536.title: Online Learning Platform – Enhancing Personalization with Self-Regulated Learning
3536.summary: This project enhances the Progresso online learning platform by integrating a Self-Regulated Learning (SRL) module. The research involves a literature review of SRL in e-learning, followed by the design, implementation, and iterative testing of the SRL module using React/Next.js, Node.js, Prisma ORM, and Firebase. A user study will assess the module's impact on learning efficiency, engagement, and retention. The expected outcome is a refined SRL-enhanced platform and a documented evaluation of its effectiveness.

3540.title: Education in the era of generative AI: Understanding the potential benefits of LLMs in teaching and learning
3540.summary: This project explores the potential of generative AI, specifically LLMs like ChatGPT, in education. Through a case study, it will investigate the opportunities and challenges these tools present for teaching and learning. The research aims to identify safe and constructive ways to leverage generative AI to improve educational practices and support student learning, ultimately providing recommendations for educators.

3541.title: Evolutionary Algorithms with Applications
3541.summary: This project explores the theory and application of evolutionary algorithms (EAs), focusing on improving EAs for specific applications by combining heuristics and adaptive methods, potentially drawing from stochastic local search. It investigates evolutionary machine learning (EML) methods using Markov chain analysis and distributed computing to handle large datasets and reduce computational costs. The project also aims to bridge the gap between parametric Markov chain theory and the AI/ML communities, particularly in the context of trustworthy AI.

3542.title: Human-Centered AI technologies for teaching and learning
3542.summary: This project explores Human-Centered AI (HCAI) and Hybrid Intelligence (HI) in education, focusing on how AI can augment teachers' abilities rather than replace them. It involves designing learning services, potentially using LearnLab's EdTech platform, and applying the six levels of automation model to define AI user roles. The project aims to understand and design HCAI technology that promotes efficient and ethical technology use in teaching, with expected outcomes including innovative interfaces or artifacts that demonstrate the challenges and opportunities of hybrid human-AI learning.

3564.title: Simulating Language and Communication Evolution
3564.summary: This project explores language and communication evolution using computational methods like evolutionary algorithms and reinforcement learning. It aims to simulate language evolution, potentially through "language games," to understand its dynamics. A key focus is addressing the limitations of current simulations, particularly their small and fixed population sizes. The expected outcome is a better understanding of language evolution through more realistic and scalable simulations.

3589.title: [2023/2024] Exploring the Effectiveness of Synthetic Data Generation in the Air Traffic Management Domain
3589.summary: This project explores synthetic data generation effectiveness in Air Traffic Management (ATM) using GANs, VAEs, and diffusion models. It evaluates synthetic data quality and its impact on machine learning models for turnaround time, flight delay, and passenger flow prediction. Addressing challenges like mixed data types and missing values, the research aims to improve ATM efficiency, robustness, and resilience through AI adoption. Expected outcomes include insights into synthetic data's ability to overcome data limitations and accelerate AI adoption in ATM.

3612.title: Understanding the execution behavior of high-level productivity languages
3612.summary: This project aims to develop a tool to analyze the execution behavior of high-level productivity languages (Python, NodeJS, Javascript) on modern hardware. The research will focus on differentiating application code and data within processor caches to understand how these languages interact with front-end and back-end processor components. The expected outcome is a tool that enables precise tracking of code and data, leading to insights for improving the performance and energy efficiency of hardware designed for these languages.

3613.title: Distributed ANN algorithms with higher recall.
3613.summary: This project focuses on developing a distributed Approximate Nearest Neighbor (ANN) algorithm to efficiently handle datasets exceeding 1 billion vectors. The research will explore various approaches for distributed ANN, emphasizing cross-machine partitioning and communication strategies to optimize performance and improve recall. The project involves extensive programming in C++ and Python, with a strong emphasis on performance evaluation and understanding computer performance characteristics. The expected outcome is a scalable and efficient distributed ANN algorithm suitable for large-scale datasets.

3617.title: Efficient Approximate Nearest Neighbour algorithms for immutable data
3617.summary: This project explores optimizing DiskANN for efficient approximate nearest neighbor search on immutable data. It involves developing a Python interface for DiskANN, investigating cross-machine partitioning and communication strategies for batch processing, and evaluating its performance against other algorithms on large datasets. The expected outcome is to identify areas for improvement in DiskANN and suggest future research directions, requiring strong C++ and Python programming skills, along with performance evaluation expertise.

3622.title: Unsupervised learning for automatically annotating eye tracking data
3622.summary: This project explores unsupervised learning techniques for automating eye movement annotation in eye-tracking data, addressing the challenge of data inaccuracies. It involves assessing existing datasets, applying unsupervised learning methods, and using data augmentation to improve annotation accuracy. The automatically generated annotations will be compared to existing annotations. The project also aims to investigate the applicability of these methods to eye-tracking data from VR headsets, accounting for the relative movement between the eye and the tracking cameras.

3623.title: Assessment of the accuracy and precision of eye trackers
3623.summary: This project aims to develop a framework for quantifying the accuracy of eye tracking in VR during movement ("in the wild"). It involves a literature review to identify existing solutions and determine whether to improve upon them or develop a new approach. The project will result in a proof-of-concept implementation that quantifies eye-tracking accuracy in a VR headset and documents the challenges encountered. Ideally, the project will also explore and test methods for programmatically improving eye-tracking accuracy in VR.

3624.title: VR environment for experiment design in medical research
3624.summary: This project explores a VR environment for medical experiment design, focusing on integrating synchronized EEG and eye-tracking data. The feasibility of using VR for neuropsychological research will be assessed, with a focus on accuracy, usability, and data visualization. The project will expand the existing VR environment by implementing neglect assessment tools, aiming to collect novel data unavailable through traditional methods. The results will inform future development and research in VR-based medical experimentation.

3629.title: IMTEL - Innovative education at the intersection of XR and ChatGPT
3629.summary: This project explores the innovative use of XR and generative AI (ChatGPT, Magic3D) to enhance education at NTNU. It investigates either developing and evaluating virtual classrooms with ChatGPT-powered virtual teaching assistants for personalized learning or exploring the use of generative AI to rapidly create 3D educational content for XR environments. The project aims to address challenges in XR content creation and improve educational tools for teachers and students, utilizing the IMTEL VR lab's extensive equipment.

3633.title: [NorwAI] Automatic Reading of Traffic Announcements
3633.summary: This project aims to develop an automatic system for reading traffic announcements for public broadcast in Sweden, utilizing speech recognition and text-to-speech technologies. The system will process traffic announcements from NRK, converting them into synthesized speech for timely and reliable dissemination. The expected outcome is an accurate and fast system that improves road safety by ensuring critical messages reach all users, regardless of radio usage. The project addresses the risk of misinterpretation to enhance driving safety and transportation management.

3636.title: Personalized Health
3636.summary: This project explores personalized health through recommender systems, aiming to tailor medical interventions to individual patients. Focusing on areas like nutrition, exercise, medication, or therapy, the project involves implementing a recommender system to optimize treatment strategies. The project requires skills in AI, machine learning, recommender systems, and programming for data processing, algorithm implementation, and demonstrator development. Expected outcomes include a functional recommender system and a demonstration of its ability to personalize interventions.

3637.title: Causal Inference for Headaches
3637.summary: This project explores causal inference techniques to identify causes and effective remedies for headaches using patient data. It involves constructing a causal graph based on expert knowledge and estimating the effects of variables on headache occurrence and pain reduction. The project utilizes AI, probability theory, and probabilistic programming. Expected outcomes include a causal model of headaches and insights into potential treatments.

3646.title: Open-ended evolution
3646.summary: This project explores open-ended evolution, aiming to replicate the endless creation of novel organisms seen in nature. It builds upon the Paired Open-Ended Trailblazer (POET) algorithm and its recent hybrid with Neuroevolution of Augmented Topologies (NEAT). The project involves either extending the existing hybrid algorithm or investigating alternative algorithmic approaches to open-ended evolution, potentially focusing on more challenging control problems with maze-like characteristics and adversaries. Expected outcomes include insights into the mechanisms driving open-endedness and the development of more robust and adaptable evolutionary algorithms.

3650.title: Generating simulations that match data ​
3650.summary: This project explores simulation-based inference for hybrid AI, combining machine learning and physical knowledge. It aims to improve model identification and uncertainty quantification in industrial applications, specifically wind turbines and compressors. The project offers two focuses: an applied approach using commercial simulation software and real-world data to match simulations with data, or a theoretical approach studying machine learning models for probability distributions under physical constraints. The project will utilize public benchmark data and proprietary simulations from DNV and Kongsberg. Expected outcomes include understanding probability density estimation, Bayesian inference, stochastic differential equations, and uncertainty quantification.

3654.title: ​Generating synthetic data​ (Sparebank1 SMN)
3654.summary: This project explores generating synthetic banking data to enable broader data sharing and analysis while preserving privacy. The research will investigate methods like GANs and statistical distributions to synthesize transactional or aggregated datasets. The goal is to create synthetic data that retains statistical relationships present in the original data without revealing personal information. The project will use de-identified data within a secure virtual machine environment. Expected outcomes include a synthesized dataset suitable for statistical inference and exploration of different synthesis approaches.

3657.title: Classifying animals in the wild
3657.summary: This project proposes developing deep learning models to classify animals and their surrounding backgrounds in wild, complex environments. Utilizing datasets like Elephant Expedition, Snapshot Wisconsin, Snapshot Serengeti, Camera catalog, and the Norwegian wildlife dataset, the research will focus on accurately labeling foreground animals (e.g., elk, rabbit, deer) and background elements (e.g., snow, grass, trees). The expected outcome is a robust classification system capable of handling challenges like varying environmental conditions and partially captured animals.

3666.title: Exploring the design space of convolutional neural networks on edge systems
3666.summary: This project explores the design space of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) on edge systems, specifically Nvidia Jetson, considering width, depth, and resolution. It investigates the impact of these dimensions on accuracy, energy efficiency, and latency. The goal is to define an effective design space for CNNs on edge devices and gain insights for designing efficient CNNs tailored for resource-constrained edge environments.

3699.title: Aneo: Ensambles for probabilistic forecasts of wind power production
3699.summary: This project explores probabilistic wind power forecasting using ensemble weather forecasts as input. The goal is to improve forecast accuracy and estimate uncertainty in wind power production for Aneo's 11 wind farms. The project involves data preparation, building machine learning models, conducting experiments to evaluate model performance, and analyzing results. The expected outcome is a methodology for utilizing weather ensembles to enhance wind power forecasting and improve profitability.

3701.title: Aneo: Predictive maintenance of cooling systems in retail stores
3701.summary: This project focuses on predictive maintenance of cooling systems in retail stores using historical event data (faults, maintenance) and sensor measurements (temperature, pressure, energy consumption). The goal is to build models that predict future faults and estimate the time until failure, enabling optimized maintenance scheduling and reduced service costs. The project involves data preparation, model building, experimentation, and results analysis, utilizing provided CSV data and cloud infrastructure.

3702.title: Aneo: Why do wind turbines fail?
3702.summary: This project aims to automate root-cause analysis of premature failures in Aneo's wind turbines, focusing on bushings, bearings, and gearboxes. It involves analyzing vibration and SCADA data to identify failure indicators. The research will explore existing methods and algorithms for root cause analysis, implementing and testing selected approaches to automate the process. The expected outcome is a system that supports maintenance decision-making by automatically identifying the root causes of wind turbine failures.

3708.title: Transforming IT operations: organisational perspectives
3708.summary: This project investigates the challenges organizations face when transitioning to DevOps. It explores how traditional IT operations functions can be reorganized within a DevOps model. The research aims to understand how organizations have managed this transition, focusing on the organizational perspectives of adopting DevOps practices. The expected outcome is a better understanding of successful strategies for implementing DevOps in organizations.

3709.title: Understanding an organisation's adaptive capacity to handle IT incidents
3709.summary: This project investigates an organization's adaptive capacity to handle IT incidents, addressing concerns about the sufficiency of current cybersecurity practices in the face of increasing cyberattacks and digital transformation. By adopting a resilience engineering perspective, the research aims to understand the socio-technical aspects of IT operations and incident response. The expected outcome is a better understanding of collaborative practices crucial for sustaining software system performance during incidents.

3710.title: Continuous software delivery utilising PaaS: opportunities and challenges
3710.summary: This project explores the adoption and effectiveness of open-source Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) solutions (e.g., nais.io, radix.equinor.com) in facilitating continuous software delivery and cloud migration within IT organizations. It investigates the rationale behind using PaaS, the benefits of open-source PaaS projects, and the challenges organizations face when adopting these platforms. The research aims to determine how well these solutions support developers in deploying applications to the cloud and their overall impact on software delivery frequency.

3712.title: Sustainable migration of cloud infrastructure
3712.summary: This project investigates sustainable cloud infrastructure migration to mitigate vendor lock-in, a significant challenge in cloud computing. It will review current strategies and explore practical solutions for reducing vendor dependency and enabling multi-cloud support. The expected outcome is enhanced robustness and flexibility in cloud systems, promoting cost savings and preventing reliance on proprietary technologies.

3724.title: Multiplayer game development using Web3 Technologies
3724.summary: This project focuses on developing a multiplayer Blackjack game using Web3 technologies, combining traditional web development with blockchain. Key technologies include a frontend UI framework, Web3 JavaScript libraries, a Spring Boot backend, and Solidity smart contracts on an EVM-compatible blockchain. The game will feature blockchain wallet-linked accounts, token transfers, and automated prize distribution. Research areas include user identity/security, scalability, account abstraction, Play2Earn aspects, cross-chain interoperability, user onboarding, and architectural best practices. The expected outcome is a functional multiplayer game demonstrating the integration of Web3 technologies and exploration of related research challenges.

3727.title: Prediksjon av råvarepriser
3727.summary: This project explores the application of machine learning and AI techniques for predicting commodity prices. The research focuses on markets experiencing or expected to experience exponential growth. The expected outcome is a model capable of forecasting commodity price fluctuations, potentially aiding investment and risk management decisions.

3728.title: AI for eyesight
3728.summary: This project explores the application of AI, specifically computer vision, to diagnose eyesight issues and improve spectacle design. Conducted in collaboration with an international startup, the research aims to develop innovative solutions for addressing eyesight problems, potentially impacting the third world. The expected outcome is a novel AI-driven approach to eyesight diagnostics and spectacle optimization.

3729.title: Software-enabled operational efficiencies in a global software scale-up
3729.summary: This project explores the use of large language models and generative AI to develop solutions for customer support and troubleshooting. The research will leverage data and domain expertise from Kantega SSO AS, a rapidly growing software company specializing in security solutions on the Atlassian platform. The expected outcome is improved operational efficiencies through AI-powered customer support and troubleshooting tools.

3731.title: Self-supervised Transformer for sensor based Human activity recognition
3731.summary: This project explores self-supervised learning with Transformer models for human activity recognition using sensor data. The research aims to adapt the Transformer architecture to effectively process sequential sensor data from accelerometers and gyroscopes. The expected outcome is a model capable of accurately classifying human activities like walking, running, and sitting, by leveraging the Transformer's ability to capture long-range dependencies in sensor data without extensive labeled datasets.

3734.title: Underwater object detection and classification
3734.summary: This project focuses on underwater object detection and classification using sonar data, underwater imagery, and machine learning. It aims to develop a system that accurately identifies and categorizes submerged objects, addressing challenges like low visibility and varying environmental conditions. Expected outcomes include enhanced understanding of marine life, archaeological sites, and underwater infrastructure, contributing to sustainable ocean management and conservation.

3735.title: From semantic to Panoptic segmentation for point cloud data analysis
3735.summary: This project explores point cloud data analysis using semantic and panoptic segmentation to improve 3D scene understanding. It aims to develop algorithms that label point clouds with object classes (semantic segmentation) and differentiate between object instances and background (panoptic segmentation). The expected outcome is a comprehensive approach bridging semantic and panoptic segmentation, enhancing applications like autonomous driving, robotics, and urban planning by improving 3D data interpretation.

3736.title: Federated Learning for Privacy-Preserving Medical Image Analysis: A Collaborative Approach
3736.summary: This project explores federated learning for privacy-preserving medical image analysis. It aims to develop a collaborative machine learning model for tasks like disease diagnosis and anomaly detection without centralizing sensitive patient data. The project focuses on training a shared model across multiple medical institutions, exchanging only model updates to maintain data privacy and minimize the risk of data breaches. The expected outcome is a robust and accurate medical image analysis system that adheres to strict privacy standards.

3737.title: FireWatch: Advanced Techniques for Wildfire Detection and Early Warning Systems
3737.summary: This project explores AI and computer vision techniques for enhanced wildfire detection and early warning systems. It utilizes remote sensing data, sensor networks, and machine learning to accurately identify wildfire signatures and optimize real-time data processing. The goal is to design efficient alert mechanisms for timely response and mitigation, ultimately minimizing the impact of wildfires on lives and the environment.

3738.title: Auto-Encoding Knowledge Graph for Unsupervised Medical Report Generation: Bridging Medical Imaging and Natural Language Processing
3738.summary: This project proposes an unsupervised approach to automatically generate medical reports by integrating medical imaging and NLP. It will use autoencoders to learn compact representations of medical images and related data, constructing a knowledge graph to capture relationships between medical concepts. The encoded knowledge graph will then be leveraged to generate coherent natural language reports, bridging the gap between imaging data and NLP. The expected outcome is an automated system capable of producing informative medical reports from images without labeled data.

3739.title: Beyond contemporary AI: A neural symbolic approach for anomaly detection in medical data
3739.summary: This project explores a neural-symbolic approach for anomaly detection in medical data. It combines the pattern recognition capabilities of neural networks with the knowledge representation and logical inference of symbolic reasoning. The goal is to improve anomaly detection accuracy and provide explainable insights into the detected anomalies, enhancing contextual understanding in medical data analysis.

3741.title: Development of ´Learn and Earn/Learn to Care’ like gaming platform using mix of Web3 and traditional gaming Technologies
3741.summary: This project proposes developing a Web3 gaming platform where players learn, earn, and create content. The platform will reward users with points exchangeable for digital assets, enabling competitive gameplay. Research will focus on architectural differences between traditional and Web3 multiplayer game development, user onboarding challenges, scalability issues, and security implications of public smart contracts. Expected outcomes include a functional gaming platform and insights into integrating Web3 technologies into gaming.

3747.title: Exciting topics in HPC & Parallel Computing
3747.summary: This project explores high-performance and parallel computing topics, including parallel algorithms, GPU features (specifically NVIDIA B100 testing), quantum computing simulations, and cloud technologies. It also considers developing edutainment for teaching parallel programming. The expected outcome is a feasible project, potentially a Master's thesis, focusing on investigating new HPC systems and educational tools.

3748.title: Automated Single-Cell Type Annotation for Salmon Skin Disease Prevention
3748.summary: This project aims to develop an automated machine-learning tool for single-cell type annotation in salmon genomic samples to aid in preventing salmon skin disease. The project will utilize Python and machine learning libraries to expedite the annotation process, which is currently a bottleneck in genomic analysis. Expected outcomes include a functional tool for predicting single-cell types, enhanced understanding of aquaculture practices, and development of machine learning expertise. The project involves collaboration with the University of Stirling and offers experience in data analysis and algorithm development.

3751.title: Design and prototyping workshops as collaborative learning activities
3751.summary: This project explores in-person workshops as collaborative learning activities for sustainable cities education. It investigates how lectures, ideation, and prototyping can equip students with multidisciplinary skills to address urban sustainability challenges. The research may involve literature reviews, case studies of existing workshops through observation and surveys, and the design of novel workshop tools and methods. The expected outcome is a better understanding of effective workshop design for sustainability education.

3792.title: Compilers for Differential Algebraic Equations
3792.summary: This project focuses on developing a compiler for Differential Algebraic Equations (DAEs) using MLIR to improve the scalability of equation-based modeling and simulation. The research involves creating a benchmark suite for compiler performance and implementing equation-manipulation algorithms. Expected outcomes include a compiler capable of efficiently translating declarative models into executable simulations, addressing the limitations of current translation algorithms in handling large state variables. The project involves collaboration with Politecnico di Milano.

3796.title: Ethical aspects of AI/recommender systems
3796.summary: This project explores the ethical challenges of AI and recommender systems, focusing on privacy, fairness, and bias from a technical perspective. It aims to define these ethical concepts as mathematical models, implement them within AI systems, and evaluate the success of these approaches. The project will involve analyzing and mitigating bias and discrimination in AI, with a specific focus on recommender systems. The expected outcome is a better understanding of how to develop AI systems that treat everyone equally and fairly.

3797.title: Learned data structures
3797.summary: This project explores learned data structures, a fusion of machine learning and data structures, to improve efficiency. It aims to design learned data structures for compressed bit vectors and range query structures by leveraging data patterns. The project will also investigate practical applications of these novel data structures.

3800.title: [ExerGames] Multi-player pedal-game 2024/2025
3800.summary: This project focuses on developing a multi-player exergame in Unity, controlled by an exercise bike and buttons. The research involves exploring existing exergames, designing and implementing a prototype, and providing feedback on the exergame framework's API. The expected outcome is a fun, engaging game that promotes physical exercise, evaluated through user experiments. Experience with Unity is required for this group project.

3801.title: [BitPet] AR Game to Motivation Socialisation and Physical Activity 2024/2025
3801.summary: This project develops an Augmented Reality game within the BitPet framework to motivate socialization and physical activity. It involves researching relevant theories, designing and developing a game concept using Unity for the front-end and a suitable back-end technology. The project culminates in a user evaluation to assess the game's effectiveness in promoting the desired behaviors. The BitPet developers will provide technical support.

3802.title: [Lecture Games] AI Multi-player Classroom Learning Games 2025/2026
3802.summary: This project focuses on developing an AI-enhanced multi-player learning game for classroom use. The goal is to create an engaging and effective educational tool where students collaborate or compete to solve challenges while learning. The project involves researching game-based learning and AI in games, implementing a game concept, and evaluating its effectiveness through user testing. Expected outcomes include a functional game prototype and an assessment of its impact on student learning.

3804.title: Uncertainty-aware Deep Learning a.k.a. Deep Bayesian Learning
3804.summary: This project explores uncertainty-aware deep learning, merging deep learning with probabilistic reasoning. It involves theoretical work and implementation using tools like TensorFlow Probability or Pyro (PyTorch). The research will address fundamental issues in deep learning, potentially drawing inspiration from resources like "The Deep Learning Book" and "ProbAI summer school." Expected outcomes include novel implementations and evaluations within a deep learning framework, requiring a strong foundation in linear algebra, statistics, machine learning, and proficiency in either TensorFlow or PyTorch.

3806.title: Using causal information to improve generative models
3806.summary: This project explores enhancing Variational Autoencoders (VAEs) by incorporating causal relationships to improve generative processes. The research focuses on leveraging external knowledge representations to guide code manipulation within VAEs. By encoding images into a disentangled latent space, the project aims to control specific attributes (e.g., gender, hair length) and allow for causally-informed interventions. The project will evaluate the quality of generated images based on the amount of side information used to achieve desired results. Technologies involved include VAEs, causal inference techniques, and potentially CausalVAE.

3807.title: AI-Driven Diagnostic Assistant for Medical Applications
3807.summary: This project focuses on developing an AI-driven web application to enhance medical diagnostics. The research involves utilizing AI technologies to analyze medical data from scintigraphy images, blood analysis, and anamnesis. The expected outcome is a diagnostic assistant that provides data visualizations and complex diagnostics, ultimately improving patient outcomes and streamlining healthcare professionals' workflows. Students can choose to focus on one or more of the data analysis areas.

3828.title: IMTEL- Workplace training in Virtual Reality in collaboration with NAV and VR4VET Erasmus + project
3828.summary: This project explores using VR and gamification to improve workplace training and career guidance for young job seekers. It aims to motivate job seekers and accelerate skill acquisition by simulating workplaces like aquaculture or shipyards. The project collaborates with the Erasmus+ VR4VET project, NAV, local industries, and European partners, leveraging the IMTEL VR lab's extensive equipment (Apple Vision Pro, Valve Index, etc.). Expected outcomes include a novel VR-based approach to vocational training, enabling active exploration of professions and introductory training.

3838.title: “Empowering Patient Privacy and Security with Self-Sovereign Identity in Electronic Health Records”
3838.summary: This project explores Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI) to enhance patient privacy and security in Electronic Health Records (EHR). It investigates current privacy challenges, assesses SSI's impact on patient engagement, and proposes SSI implementation recommendations. The methodology includes literature review, case studies, and surveys/interviews. Expected outcomes include increased understanding of SSI benefits, insights into patient empowerment, and recommendations for integrating SSI into EHR systems.

3839.title: “Designing a Next Generation Patient-Centric Electronic Health Record (EHR) Platform Based on Decentralised Technologies”
3839.summary: This project proposes designing a decentralized Electronic Health Record (EHR) platform leveraging Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI) to enhance patient autonomy and data security. The research will involve developing a user-centric architecture and prototype mirroring the Norwegian EHR setting.
